headline: The Fruit of the Wise Man
description: A parable of wisdom and irony â€” the seeker ascends the mountain to find enlightenment, only to encounter deception that conceals divine truth. Through humor, hunger, and reversal, folly becomes the first taste of understanding.

motifMap.meaning: Fruit as knowledge â€” wisdom that must be bitten into, not admired.
Mountain as inversion â€” the sacred climb that reveals folly rather than transcendence.
Trickster energy â€” divine humor unmasking false reverence.
Grace within irony â€” truth delivered through absurd means.
